page.title: 18INDUSTRY COOKE'S WORKS
page.content: Although the area is mainly rural in character, Penrhyn is usually associated with Cooke's Explosive Works, a subsidiary of I.C.I. Employing 150 people in 2 shifts 6am-2pm-9pm the explosive produced is known as PENOBEL ( after the village and the inventor of dynamite). Raw materials from many sources are taken by train to Blaenau ffestiniog and then by lorry to the factory. The explosives produced are also distributed by road and rail through B. Ff. to coal mines and quarries in the UK and abroad. The local stone quarry also uses the explosives. Until the Barmouth viaduct was weakened by marine worms, materials were handled at the local station, & although repair is almost complete the goods sidings were lifted in 1985 so goods trains will not stop here again.
